decks.notes: The main focus of this Boros Aggro deck is to utilize low-cost creatures such as Thraben Inspector and Glint Hawk, along with efficient burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Blast, to apply early pressure on the opponent. The deck also incorporates token generation cards like Battle Screech and Cenn's Enlistment to maintain a strong board presence and overwhelm the opponent quickly. Additionally, mana fixing is provided by cards like Prophetic Prism and Boros Garrison, allowing for smoother gameplay and consistent aggression.

This deck focuses on playing low-cost, efficient creatures that can quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggression. By utilizing cards like Burning-Tree Emissary and Nettle Sentinel to generate mana and play multiple threats early on, combined with powerful pump spells like Elephant Guide and Rancor, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and close out the game quickly. With a solid mix of evasion, resilience, and pump effects, Mono Green Aggro aims to win the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw. By using cards like Counterspell, Chainer's Edict, and Disfigure, along with the powerful Gurmag Angler and Mulldrifter creatures, the deck aims to control the board and out-value the opponent. With a variety of options for card advantage and interaction, this deck seeks to outlast and outmaneuver opponents in a slower, more controlling game.

The main focus of this deck is to establish early board presence through cheap and efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Faerie Miscreant, while maintaining control with countermagic such as Counterspell and Spellstutter Sprite. Ninja of the Deep Hours provides card advantage and tempo advantage, and cards like Ponder and Preordain help dig for key pieces. The deck aims to pressure the opponent while disrupting their game plan, ultimately seeking to out value and out tempo the opponent to secure victory.

The main focus of this Dimir Control deck is to control the game through card advantage and removal spells. The deck utilizes cards like Chittering Rats and Mulldrifter to keep the opponent's hand empty and board clear. With counterspells like Counterspell and removal spells like Chainer's Edict and Doom Blade, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while gaining incremental advantage. The inclusion of cards like Archaeomancer and Ghostly Flicker also allows for recurring key spells and generating additional value. The deck thrives on outlasting the opponent and winning in the late game.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with low-cost, efficient creatures that are difficult to remove. By consistently playing creatures and using pump spells like Hunger of the Howlpack, Vines of Vastwood, Elephant Guide, and Rancor, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can establish their own game plan. The inclusion of mana accelerants like Nest Invader and Burning-Tree Emissary helps to ramp up the aggression early on, while cards like Quirion Ranger provide additional flexibility in mana usage.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through card advantage and tempo plays. The deck aims to use cards like Dinrova Horror and Mulldrifter to disrupt the opponent while generating value with cards like Mnemonic Wall and Compulsive Research. The deck also utilizes flicker effects like Ghostly Flicker to reuse powerful enter-the-battlefield abilities and gain more advantage. The deck also includes mana ramp creatures like God-Pharaoh's Faithful and Nightscape Familiar to help stabilize the early game and reach its late game win conditions.

The main focus of this deck is to relentlessly apply pressure on the opponent with cheap, efficient burn spells and aggressive creatures. By quickly depleting the opponent's life total, the goal is to win the game before the opponent can stabilize or mount a defense. The deck excels at dealing consistent damage and closing out games at a rapid pace. It emphasizes speed and aggression to overwhelm the opponent and secure a victory through direct damage and efficient card advantage.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm your opponent with a swarm of cheap artifact creatures and use various spells to power them up and deal damage quickly. By combining the aggressive nature of the Aggro archetype with the synergy and efficiency of the Affinity mechanic, this deck aims to establish a dominant presence on the battlefield and push for a fast victory. The focus is on casting multiple creatures for little to no cost, drawing cards for additional resources, and utilizing burn spells and combat tricks to close out the game swiftly.

The main idea of this Pauper 1 vs 1 Aggro deck is to quickly build up a board presence with cheap creatures like Augur of Bolas, Kiln Fiend, and Nivix Cyclops, while efficiently chaining card draw spells like Gitaxian Probe, Ponder, and Preordain. The deck aims to protect its threats with cards like Apostle's Blessing and Daze, while also leveraging pump spells like Mutagenic Growth and Temur Battle Rage to finish off opponents quickly. The mana base is streamlined with Ash Barrens, Evolving Wilds, and a mix of Islands and Mountains to ensure consistent casting of spells.

This Mono Green Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with efficient and aggressive creatures. By utilizing various combat tricks and pumping spells, the deck aims to deal damage fast and efficiently. With a low mana curve and a mix of creatures with haste and evasion, the deck can apply pressure from the early game onwards. Additionally, the deck includes tools for resilience and card advantage to ensure it can maintain its aggression throughout the game.

This deck focuses on quickly establishing board presence with low-cost creatures and disrupting the opponent with counterspells while maintaining card advantage through card draw and evasive creatures. It aims to apply pressure early on with aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Ninja of the Deep Hours, creating a fast clock for the opponent to deal with. The inclusion of cards like Skred and Lightning Bolt provides removal options and the ability to control the board when necessary. The deck's flexibility allows it to adapt to various matchups and strategies.

The main focus of this deck is to control the tempo of the game while maintaining a strong aggro presence through early game creatures like Faerie Miscreant and Delver of Secrets. Utilizing cards like Counterspell, Spellstutter Sprite, and Skred, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while also maintaining card advantage through Ninja of the Deep Hours. The inclusion of Gush allows for extra card draw and flexibility in mana usage. With a mix of counterspells, removal, and card draw, this deck aims to secure victory through a blend of aggression and resource management.

The deck focuses on utilizing low-cost creatures and efficient pump spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive attacks. By utilizing creatures like Nest Invader and Burning-Tree Emissary to generate extra resources, along with powerful enchantments like Rancor and Elephant Guide to boost their power, the deck aims to quickly establish a threatening board presence. The inclusion of cards like Nettle Sentinel and Quirion Ranger also allows for potential combo plays and additional flexibility in combat. Overall, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and end the game swiftly before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on rapidly deploying creatures and disrupting opponents' game plans with countermagic. By utilizing efficient flying creatures like Delver of Secrets and Spellstutter Sprite, along with card draw spells like Ponder and Preordain, it can quickly build a board presence while maintaining a quick tempo. The inclusion of Ninja of the Deep Hours allows for extra card advantage and the ability to bounce creatures for additional value. Additionally, the deck aims to protect its threats with countermagic like Counterspell and disruption spells like Vapor Snag, making it difficult for opponents to stabilize.

The focus of this deck is to quickly establish a board presence and control the game through efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Ninja of the Deep Hours. It utilizes faeries and counterspells to disrupt the opponent's strategy, while also generating card advantage with cards like Ponder and Preordain. The deck aims to tempo out opponents with cards like Gush and efficiently close out games with aggressive creatures and evasive threats. The mana base is streamlined with Islands to ensure consistent casting of spells and creatures.

The main focus of this deck is to apply early pressure with low casting cost creatures like Delver of Secrets and Faerie Miscreant, while maintaining card advantage through cards like Augur of Bolas and Ninja of the Deep Hours. Counterspell and Spellstutter Sprite help control the board, while cards like Lightning Bolt provide additional reach. The deck also includes card draw and manipulation spells like Ponder and Preordain to ensure consistency in draws. The inclusion of snow-covered lands allows for Skred to function as a powerful removal spell.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by using a variety of spells such as Counterspell, Chainer's Edict, and removal spells like Doom Blade and Disfigure. The deck focuses on card advantage through draw spells like Preordain and Accumulated Knowledge, while also utilizing creatures like Augur of Bolas and Gurmag Angler to maintain board presence. The mana base is built around Dimir lands to ensure consistency in casting spells. Overall, the deck aims to outlast the opponent by controlling the board and making efficient use of resources.

The deck focuses on quickly playing low-cost artifacts to ramp up mana and swarm the board with creatures. It utilizes cards like Springleaf Drum and Prophetic Prism to enable fast mana generation and card draw. Atogs and other artifact creatures like Myr Enforcer and Frogmite are quickly deployed to overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes removal spells like Galvanic Blast to clear the way for efficient attacks. Overall, the strategy is to flood the board with artifacts and creatures to quickly defeat the opponent.
